title: Ticket #4369: SubmitterUserPrio does not work in PREEMPTION_REQUIREMENTS|RANK
description:
The Manual in section 3.4.3 lists attributes that can be used in PREEMPTION_REQUIREMENTS and PREEMPTION_RANK expressions. One such attribute documented is SubmitterUserPrio. Unfortunately, this is broken due to a typo in the source code! From file /src/condor_includes/condor_attributes.h - behold the misspelling of the attribute: 
#define ATTR_SUBMITTER_USER_PRIO  "SubmittorUserPrio"

Looks safe to simply correct the spelling so HTCondor operates as documented, as the code still uses SubmittorPrio internally (for backwards compatibilities when SubmitterUserPrio was first introduced). However, I am putting this into v8.2.0 because 1) v8.2.0 is imminent and v8.0.x is about to be declared dead except for security fixes, and 2) I want be sure semantics don't change in the middle of a stable series, even 'broken' semantics.

A work-around for older versions of HTCondor is to use SubmittorPrio instead, as SubmitterUserPrio was from the get-go just a more aesthetically pleasing/consistent synonym name for SubmittorPrio.
remarks:
2014-May-19 13:21:08 by tannenba:
Besides this typo causing issues for folks who want to believe the documentation, note that HTCondor's defaults also assume the correct spelling: 

C:\home\tannenba\condor\CONDOR_SRC\src>git grep SubmitterUserPrio
condor_examples/condor_config.annotated:        && (RemoteUserPrio > TARGET.SubmitterUserPrio * 1.2)) \
condor_examples/condor_config.generic.redhat:   && (RemoteUserPrio > TARGET.SubmitterUserPrio * 1.2)) \
condor_utils/param_info.in:default=((SubmitterGroup =?= RemoteGroup) && ($(StateTimer) > (1 * $(HOUR))) && (RemoteUserPrio > TARGET.SubmitterUserPrio * 1.2)) || (MY.NiceUser == True)

Also note that SubmittorPrio cannot go away anytime soon as it is referenced in places that SubmitterUserPrio is not - for instance: 

C:\home\tannenba\condor\CONDOR_SRC\src>git grep ATTR_SUBMITT | grep PRIO
classad_analysis/analysis.cpp:  preempt_prio << "MY." << ATTR_REMOTE_USER_PRIO << " > TARGET." << ATTR_SUBMITTOR_PRIO << "
 + " << PriorityDelta;
condor_includes/condor_attributes.h:#define ATTR_SUBMITTOR_PRIO  "SubmittorPrio"   // old-style for ATTR_SUBMITTER_USER_PR
IO
condor_includes/condor_attributes.h:#define ATTR_SUBMITTER_USER_PRIO  "SubmittorUserPrio"   // old-style for ATTR_SUBMITTE
R_USER_PRIO
condor_negotiator.V6/matchmaker.cpp:    external_references.remove_anycase(ATTR_SUBMITTOR_PRIO);
condor_negotiator.V6/matchmaker.cpp:    external_references.remove_anycase(ATTR_SUBMITTER_USER_PRIO);
condor_negotiator.V6/matchmaker.cpp:            // first insert old-style ATTR_SUBMITTOR_PRIO
condor_negotiator.V6/matchmaker.cpp:            request.Assign(ATTR_SUBMITTOR_PRIO , (float)priority );
condor_negotiator.V6/matchmaker.cpp:            // next insert new-style ATTR_SUBMITTER_USER_PRIO
condor_negotiator.V6/matchmaker.cpp:            request.Assign(ATTR_SUBMITTER_USER_PRIO , (float)priority );
condor_q.V6/queue.cpp:                  ATTR_SUBMITTOR_PRIO, PriorityDelta );
condor_q.V6/queue.cpp:                  request->Assign(ATTR_SUBMITTOR_PRIO, prioTable[ixSubmittor].prio);
condor_tools/give_interactive.cpp:      requestAd.Assign(ATTR_SUBMITTOR_PRIO, priority);
condor_utils/compat_classad.cpp:        ATTR_SUBMITTER_USER_PRIO,
condor_utils/compat_classad.cpp:        ATTR_SUBMITTOR_PRIO,

2014-Jun-05 12:47:48 by zmiller:
CODE REVIEW by zmiller. Looks good.

2014-Jun-23 11:25:33 by tannenba:
Also reported on htcondor-users by Alexey... so embarrassing.

2014-Jun-24 11:00   Check-in [40496]: documentation for #4369 (By Todd Tannenbaum )
2014-May-19 13:45   Check-in [40171]: Fix problems with SubmitterUserPrio. #4369 The manual documents SubmitterUserPrio, but the source code had it misspelled as SubmittorUserPrio. Sigh. (By Todd Tannenbaum )
creator: tannenba
